title: weekdays
excerpt: how yall getting days of the week using the date
content:
```py
def dayOfWeek(year, month, day):
    t = [0, 3, 2, 5, 0, 3, 5, 1, 4, 6, 2, 4]

    if month < 3:
        year -= 1

    return (year + year // 4 - year // 100 + year // 400 + t[month - 1] + day) % 7

mapping = ["Sunday", "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday"]
print(mapping[dayOfWeek(2025, 8, 24)])```

this is called uhh the tomohiko sakamoto's algorithm.
im too lazy to express your concepts in text so here's this.
```py
import math

C = [0, 31, 59, 90, 120, 151, 181, 212, 243, 273, 304, 334] # days before month

def totaldays(y, m, d):
    return 365*y + math.floor(y/4) - math.floor(y/100) + math.floor(y/400) + C[m] + (d - 1)

print(f"Total days since 2025-08-24 if all years are non-leap years are: {totaldays(2025, 8, 24)}")
```
